original_query: What information can you find in SAMPLE-Indian-Policies-and-Procedures-January-2023.docx?

perception.result_requirement: Summary of the information contained in the document SAMPLE-Indian-Policies-and-Procedures-January-2023.docx
perception.reasoning: The user is asking for information within a specific document. I need to use a tool that can access and read the document to extract and summarize the information. The goal is not directly achievable without using a tool.
perception.local_reasoning: The query requires accessing and processing the contents of a document, which cannot be done without a tool. Therefore, the local goal of directly answering the query is not achievable at this stage.

plan_text: Step 0: Extract the content from the provided document.
Step 1: Search stored documents using RAG to summarize the content.
Step 2: Present the summary to the user.

execution_result.result:
Key points from the PDF:

- ['type=\'text\' text=\'{\\n  "markdown": "## Page 1\\\\n\\\\nAll text in bold can be edited to meet the needs of the Tribe(s) or\\\\nLEA.\\\\nIndian Policies and Procedures\\\\n________________________ School District\\\\n____________________ School Year\\\\nThese policies and procedures will be reviewed annually, and\\\\nrevisions will be made within 90 days of the determination that\\\\nrequirements are not being adequately met. [34 CFR 222.94(c)2-3]\\\\nAll changes become effective upon board approval.\\\\nTribe’s preferred method(s) of communication: LIST HERE (email,\\\\nFacebook post, school newsletter, etc.)\\\\nPolicy 1: The LEA will disseminate relevant applications,\\\\nevaluations, program plans and information related to the LEA\\\'s\\\\neducation program and activities with sufficient advance notice to\\\\nallow tribes and parents of Indian children the opportunity to\\\\nreview and make recommendations. [34 CFR 222.94(b)(1)]\\\\nProcedure 1: The school district will disseminate the following\\\\ndocuments to the parents of Indian children and the tribe at least\\\\none week in advance of any meeting to discuss these documents.\\\\nThe documents will be disseminated using the tribe’s preferred\\\\nmethod of communication. The documents to be disseminated\\\\ninclude:\\\\nCurrent year Impact Aid application\\\\nAssessment/Evaluation of Equal Participation\\\\nIndian Policies Procedures (IPPs)\\\\nAny Plans for District education programs\\\\nWritten responses to feedback from the consultation process\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n## Page 2\\\\n\\\\nPolicy 2: The LEA will provide an opportunity for the tribe and\\\\nparents of Indian children to provide their views on the LEA’s\\\\neducational program and activities, including recommendations on\\\\nthe needs of their children and how the LEA may help those\\\\nchildren realize the benefits of the LEA’s education programs and\\\\nactivities. [34 CFR 222.94(b)(2)]\\\\nAs a part of this requirement, the LEA will-\\\\n(i) Notify tribes and the parents of Indian children of the\\\\nopportunity to submit comments and recommendations, considering\\\\nthe tribe\\\'s preference for method of communication, and\\\\n(ii) Modify the method of and time for soliciting Indian views, if\\\\nnecessary, to ensure the maximum participation of tribes and\\\\nparents of Indian children.\\\\nProcedure 2:\\\\n2.1 The School District will hold one annual board meeting to allow\\\\nthe parents of Indian children and the tribe(s) to provide input on\\\\nthe educational program and activities. The School District will give\\\\nparents of Indian children, tribes, and the public notice of any\\\\nmeeting at least one week in advance via the tribe’s preferred\\\\nmethod of communication.\\\\n2.2 If the consultation participation by parents of Indian children\\\\nand tribes is low, the School District will re-evaluate its consultation\\\\nprocess. Specifically, the School District will take the following\\\\nmeasures to improve or enhance participation:\\\\nConsult with parents of Indian children and tribes\\\\nChange communication method\\\\nChange time of meeting\\\\nPolicy 3: The LEA will, at least annually, assess the extent to which\\\\nIndian children participate on an equal basis with non-Indian\\\\nchildren in the LEA’s education program and activities. [34 CFR\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n## Page 3\\\\n\\\\n222.94(b)(3)]\\\\nAs part of this requirement, the LEA will: (i) Share relevant\\\\ninformation related to Indian children\\\'s participation in the LEA\\\'s\\\\neducation program and activities with tribes and parents of Indian\\\\nchildren; and\\\\n(ii) Allow tribes and parents of Indian children the opportunity and\\\\ntime to review and comment on whether Indian children participate\\\\non an equal basis with non-Indian children.\\\\nProcedure 3:\\\\n3.1 The School District shall annually calculate from its records the\\\\nratio of Indian children compared to non-Indian children\\\\nparticipating in all academic and co-curricular programs.\\\\n3.2 Parents of Indian children, tribes and other interested parties\\\\nmay express their views on participation at the annual school board\\\\nmeeting on Impact Aid.\\\\n3.3 If it is determined that there are gaps in Indian participation in\\\\nthe educational program or activities, the School Board in\\\\nconsultation with the tribes and the parents of Indian children, will\\\\nmodify its education program in such a way as to improve Indian\\\\nparticipation.\\\\nPolicy 4: The LEA will modify the IPPs if necessary, based upon the\\\\nresults of any assessment or input described in paragraph (b) of this\\\\nsection (this document). [34CFR222.94(b)(4)]\\\\nProcedure 4:\\\\n4.1 The School Board will schedule a school board meeting at least\\\\nonce annually to consult with the tribe and parents of Indian\\\\nchildren on the content of the IPPs, equal participation, and\\\\neducational program and activities. Parents of Indian children and\\\\ntribes will be notified via the tribe’s preferred method of\\\\ncommunication regarding this meeting and their ability to submit\\\\ncomment.\\\\n4.2 The School Board will evaluate all recommendations and\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n## Page 4\\\\n\\\\nrecommend revisions for changes to these IPPs.\\\\n4.3 Any changes by the School Board will become effective\\\\nimmediately upon formal adoption.\\\\n4.5 The School District will disseminate copies of the revised IPPs to\\\\nthe tribe and parents of Indian children via the tribe’s preferred\\\\nmethod of communication within 30 days of adoption by the School\\\\nBoard.\\\\nPolicy 5: The LEA will respond at least annually in writing to\\\\ncomments and recommendations made by tribes or parents of\\\\nIndian children, and disseminate the responses to the tribe and\\\\nparents of Indian children prior to the submission of the IPPs by the\\\\nLEA. [34CFR222.94(b)(5)]\\\\nProcedure 5:\\\\n5.1 The School District will annually keep track of and assemble all\\\\ncomments and suggestions received through the consultation\\\\nprocesses by keeping minutes at the school board meeting to discuss\\\\nImpact Aid.\\\\n5.2 The School District will at least annually respond in writing to\\\\ncomments and recommendations made by tribes, or parents of\\\\nIndian children, and disseminate the responses to all parties via the\\\\ntribe’s preferred method of communication prior to the submission\\\\nof the IPPs by the District.\\\\nPolicy 6: The LEA will provide a copy of the IPPs annually to the\\\\naffected tribe or tribes. [34 CFR 222.94 (b)(6)]\\\\nProcedure 6:\\\\nThe School District will annually provide a copy of the current\\\\nIndian Policies and Procedures to the tribe using the tribe’s\\\\npreferred method of communication prior to submitting the Impact\\\\nAid Application.\\\\nLEA Board Approval Date: Month Date, Year\\\\n"\\n}\' annotations=None']

execution_result.result: ["type='text' text='on whether Indian children participate on an equal basis with non-Indian children. Procedure 3: 3.1 The School District shall **annually calculate from its records the ratio of Indian children compared to non-Indian children participating in all academic and co-curricular programs**. 3.2 Parents of Indian children, tribes and other interested parties may express their views on participation at **the annual school board meeting on Impact Aid.** 3.3 If it is determined that there are gaps in Indian participation in the educational program or activities, the School Board in consultation with the tribes and the parents of Indian children, will **modify its education program in such a way as to improve Indian participation.** Policy 4: The LEA will modify the IPPs if necessary, based upon the results of any assessment or input described in paragraph (b) of this section (*this document)*. [34CFR222.94(b)(4)] Procedure 4: 4.1 The School Board will schedule a school board meeting at least **once annually** to consult with the tribe and parents of Indian children on the content of the IPPs, equal participation, and educational program and activities. Parents of Indian children and tribes will be notified **via the tribe’s preferred method of communication** regarding this meeting and their ability to submit comment. 4.2 **The School Board** will evaluate all recommendations and recommend revisions for changes to these IPPs. 4.3 Any changes by the School Board will become effective **immediately upon formal adoption**. 4.5 The School District will disseminate copies of the revised IPPs to the tribe and parents of Indian children **via the tribe’s preferred method of communication** within 30 days of adoption by the School Board. Policy 5: The LEA will respond at least annually in writing to comments and recommendations made by tribes or parents of Indian children, and disseminate the responses to the tribe and parents of Indian children prior to the submission of the IPPs by the LEA. [34CFR222.94(b)(5)] Procedure 5: 5.1 The School District will annually keep track of and assemble all comments and suggestions received through the consultation processes by **keeping minutes at the school board meeting to discuss Impact Aid**. 5.2 The School District will **at least annually** respond in writing to comments and recommendations made by tribes, or parents of Indian children, and disseminate the responses to all parties **via the tribe’s preferred method of communication** prior to the submission of the IPPs by the District. Policy 6: The LEA will provide a copy of the IPPs annually to the affected tribe or tribes. [34 CFR 222.94 (b)(6)] Procedure 6: The School District will annually provide a copy of the current Indian Policies and Procedures to the tribe **using the** **tribe’s preferred method of communication** **prior to submitting the Impact Aid Application**. LEA Board Approval Date: **Month Date, Year**\\n[Source: SAMPLE-Indian-Policies-and-Procedures-January-2023.docx, ID: SAMPLE-Indian-Policies-and-Procedures-January-2023_1]' annotations=None", "type='text' text='filed with the Appellate Committee for grant of height permission of High-rise building projects from Airport Authority of India.|Through trade chambers|No|-|-| |4|Clarification regarding OC & CC Act (Obtaining Occupancy Certificate and Certificate for Completion) as per RERA Act (In reference to the Hon’ble Supreme Court Writ Petition Civil No. 1216/ 2020; Interim Order dated 9 January 2023)|Through trade chambers|No|-|-| PRINCIPLE 8: Businesses should promote inclusive growth and equitable development **Essential Indicators** 1. \\x07Details of Social Impact Assessments (SIA) of projects undertaken by the entity based on applicable laws, in the current FY. |Name and brief details of project|SIA Notification No.|Date of notification|Whether conducted by independent external agency (Y/ N)|Results communicated in public domain (Y/ N)|Relevant Web Link| |---|---|---|---|---|---| |Not Applicable|||||| 2. \\x07Provide information on project(s) for which ongoing Rehabilitation and Resettlement (R&R) is being undertaken by your entity, in the following format: |S. No.|Name of Project for which R&R is ongoing|State|District|No. of Project Affected Families (PAFs)|% of PAFs covered by R&R|Amounts paid to PAFs in the FY (In INR)| |---|---|---|---|---|---|---| |Not Applicable||||||| 3. Describe the mechanisms to receive and redress grievances of the community. DLF engages with community members through its social arm - DLF Foundation. Community stakeholders can report their concerns and grievances to DLF through dedicated channels listed on the website on DLF Foundation ( **https://www.dlffoundation.in/contact.php** ) including contact no., e-mail and office address. Community members can also send any concerns or grievances by writing to the official e-mail id of DLF Foundation ( **dlf-foundation@dlf.in** ). This promotes a formal mechanism for understanding and resolving grievances of community members in a just, fair and timely manner. In addition, DLF is closely connected with community members through its CSR programmes. The respective programme team engages with the community stakeholders through community meetings and feedback sessions to receive and redress concerns of the communities. 44 Content ----- 4. steps.description: Summarize the content of the document.

tool_arguments.code:
result = "The document 'SAMPLE-Indian-Policies-and-Procedures-January-2023.docx' discusses policies and procedures related to Indian children's participation in school programs, Impact Aid, and communication with tribes. It also covers the School Board's responsibilities in modifying education programs to improve Indian participation and disseminating revised policies. Additionally, the DLF BRSR.pdf discusses topics such as social impact assessments, rehabilitation and resettlement projects, mechanisms for grievance redressal, CSR projects, and policies related to environmental impacts and public policy advocacy."
return result

It also covers the School Board's responsibilities in modifying education programs to improve Indian participation and disseminating revised policies. Additionally, the DLF BRSR.pdf discusses topics such as social impact assessments, rehabilitation and resettlement projects, mechanisms for grievance redressal, CSR projects, and policies related to environmental impacts and public policy advocacy.

The documents to be disseminated\\\\ninclude:\\\\nCurrent year Impact Aid application\\\\nAssessment/Evaluation of Equal Participation\\\\nIndian Policies Procedures (IPPs)\\\\nAny Plans for District education programs\\\\nWritten responses to feedback from the consultation process\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n## Page 2\\\\n\\\\nPolicy 2: The LEA will provide an opportunity for the tribe and\\\\nparents of Indian children to provide their views on the LEA’s\\\\neducational program and activities, including recommendations on\\\\nthe needs of their children and how the LEA may help those\\\\nchildren realize the benefits of the LEA’s education programs and\\\\nactivities. [34 CFR 222.94(b)(2)]\\\\nAs a part of this requirement, the LEA will-\\\\n(i) Notify tribes and the parents of Indian children of the\\\\nopportunity to submit comments and recommendations, considering\\\\nthe tribe\\\'s preference for method of communication, and\\\\n(ii) Modify the method of and time for soliciting Indian views, if\\\\nnecessary, to ensure the maximum participation of tribes and\\\\nparents of Indian children.\\\\nProcedure 2:\\\\n2.1 The School District will hold one annual board meeting to allow\\\\nthe parents of Indian children and the tribe(s) to provide input on\\\\nthe educational program and activities. The School District will give\\\\nparents of Indian children, tribes, and the public notice of any\\\\nmeeting at least one week in advance via the tribe’s preferred\\\\nmethod of communication.\\\\n2.2 If the consultation participation by parents of Indian children\\\\nand tribes is low, the School District will re-evaluate its consultation\\\\nprocess. Specifically, the School District will take the following\\\\nmeasures to improve or enhance participation:\\\\nConsult with parents of Indian children and tribes\\\\nChange communication method\\\\nChange time of meeting\\\\nPolicy 3: The LEA will, at least annually, assess the extent to which\\\\nIndian children participate on an equal basis with non-Indian\\\\nchildren in the LEA’s education program and activities. [34 CFR\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n## Page 3\\\\n\\\\n222.94(b)(3)]\\\\nAs part of this requirement, the LEA will: (i) Share relevant\\\\ninformation related to Indian children\\\'s participation in the LEA\\\'s\\\\neducation program and activities with tribes and parents of Indian\\\\nchildren; and\\\\n(ii) Allow tribes and parents of Indian children the opportunity and\\\\ntime to review and comment on whether Indian children participate\\\\non an equal basis with non-Indian children.\\\\nProcedure 3:\\\\n3.1 The School District shall annually calculate from its records the\\\\nratio of Indian children compared to non-Indian children\\\\nparticipating in all academic and co-curricular programs.\\\\n3.2 Parents of Indian children, tribes and other interested parties\\\\nmay express their views on participation at the annual school board\\\\nmeeting on Impact Aid.\\\\n3.3 If it is determined that there are gaps in Indian participation in\\\\nthe educational program or activities, the School Board in\\\\nconsultation with the tribes and the parents of Indian children, will\\\\nmodify its education program in such a way as to improve Indian\\\\nparticipation.\\\\nPolicy 4: The LEA will modify the IPPs if necessary, based upon the\\\\nresults of any assessment or input described in paragraph (b) of this\\\\nsection (this document). [34CFR222.94(b)(4)]\\\\nProcedure 4:\\\\n4.1 The School Board will schedule a school board meeting at least\\\\nonce annually to consult with the tribe and parents of Indian\\\\nchildren on the content of the IPPs, equal participation, and\\\\neducational program and activities. Parents of Indian children and\\\\ntribes will be notified via the tribe’s preferred method of\\\\ncommunication regarding this meeting and their ability to submit\\\\ncomment.\\\\n4.2 The School Board will evaluate all recommendations and\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n## Page 4\\\\n\\\\nrecommend revisions for changes to these IPPs.\\\\n4.3 Any changes by the School Board will become effective\\\\nimmediately upon formal adoption.\\\\n4.5 The School District will disseminate copies of the revised IPPs to\\\\nthe tribe and parents of Indian children via the tribe’s preferred\\\\nmethod of communication within 30 days of adoption by the School\\\\nBoard.\\\\nPolicy 5: The LEA will respond at least annually in writing to\\\\ncomments and recommendations made by tribes or parents of\\\\nIndian children, and disseminate the responses to the tribe and\\\\nparents of Indian children prior to the submission of the IPPs by the\\\\nLEA. [34CFR222.94(b)(5)]\\\\nProcedure 5:\\\\n5.1 The School District will annually keep track of and assemble all\\\\ncomments and suggestions received through the consultation\\\\nprocesses by keeping minutes at the school board meeting to discuss\\\\nImpact Aid.\\\\n5.2 The School District will at least annually respond in writing to\\\\ncomments and recommendations made by tribes, or parents of\\\\nIndian children, and disseminate the responses to all parties via the\\\\ntribe’s preferred method of communication prior to the submission\\\\nof the IPPs by the District.\\\\nPolicy 6: The LEA will provide a copy of the IPPs annually to the\\\\naffected tribe or tribes. [34 CFR 222.94 (b)(6)]\\\\nProcedure 6:\\\\nThe School District will annually provide a copy of the current\\\\nIndian Policies and Procedures to the tribe using the tribe’s\\\\npreferred method of communication prior to submitting the Impact\\\\nAid Application.\\\\nLEA Board Approval Date: Month Date, Year\\\\n"\\n}\' annotations=None']

perception.result_requirement: Summary of key points from the PDF regarding Indian Policies and Procedures.
perception.reasoning: The step extracted key points from the PDF, which is a step towards summarizing the document. It hasn't fully answered the original query but has provided the necessary information to create the summary in the next step.
perception.local_reasoning: The step successfully extracted the key points from the PDF document, fulfilling the objective of Step 0. These points are relevant to understanding and summarizing the content.

final_steps.description: Search stored documents using RAG to summarize the content.

execution_result.result: ["type='text' text='on whether Indian children participate on an equal basis with non-Indian children. Procedure 3: 3.1 The School District shall **annually calculate from its records the ratio of Indian children compared to non-Indian children participating in all academic and co-curricular programs**. 3.2 Parents of Indian children, tribes and other interested parties may express their views on participation at **the annual school board meeting on Impact Aid.** 3.3 If it is determined that there are gaps in Indian participation in the educational program or activities, the School Board in consultation with the tribes and the parents of Indian children, will **modify its education program in such a way as to improve Indian participation.** Policy 4: The LEA will modify the IPPs if necessary, based upon the results of any assessment or input described in paragraph (b) of this section (*this document)*. [34CFR222.94(b)(4)] Procedure 4: 4.1 The School Board will schedule a school board meeting at least **once annually** to consult with the tribe and parents of Indian children on the content of the IPPs, equal participation, and educational program and activities. Parents of Indian children and tribes will be notified **via the tribe’s preferred method of communication** regarding this meeting and their ability to submit comment. 4.2 **The School Board** will evaluate all recommendations and recommend revisions for changes to these IPPs. 4.3 Any changes by the School Board will become effective **immediately upon formal adoption**. 4.5 The School District will disseminate copies of the revised IPPs to the tribe and parents of Indian children **via the tribe’s preferred method of communication** within 30 days of adoption by the School Board. Policy 5: The LEA will respond at least annually in writing to comments and recommendations made by tribes or parents of Indian children, and disseminate the responses to the tribe and parents of Indian children prior to the submission of the IPPs by the LEA. [34CFR222.94(b)(5)] Procedure 5: 5.1 The School District will annually keep track of and assemble all comments and suggestions received through the consultation processes by **keeping minutes at the school board meeting to discuss Impact Aid**. 5.2 The School District will **at least annually** respond in writing to comments and recommendations made by tribes, or parents of Indian children, and disseminate the responses to all parties **via the tribe’s preferred method of communication** prior to the submission of the IPPs by the District. Policy 6: The LEA will provide a copy of the IPPs annually to the affected tribe or tribes. [34 CFR 222.94 (b)(6)] Procedure 6: The School District will annually provide a copy of the current Indian Policies and Procedures to the tribe **using the** **tribe’s preferred method of communication** **prior to submitting the Impact Aid Application**. Describe the mechanisms to receive and redress grievances of the community. DLF engages with community members through its social arm - DLF Foundation. Community stakeholders can report their concerns and grievances to DLF through dedicated channels listed on the website on DLF Foundation ( **https://www.dlffoundation.in/contact.php** ) including contact no., e-mail and office address. Community members can also send any concerns or grievances by writing to the official e-mail id of DLF Foundation ( **dlf-foundation@dlf.in** ). This promotes a formal mechanism for understanding and resolving grievances of community members in a just, fair and timely manner. In addition, DLF is closely connected with community members through its CSR programmes. The respective programme team engages with the community stakeholders through community meetings and feedback sessions to receive and redress concerns of the communities. 44 Content ----- 4. tool_arguments.code:
result = "The document 'SAMPLE-Indian-Policies-and-Procedures-January-2023.docx' discusses policies and procedures related to Indian children's participation in school programs, Impact Aid, and communication with tribes. It also covers the School Board's responsibilities in modifying education programs to improve Indian participation and disseminating revised policies. Additionally, the DLF BRSR.pdf discusses topics such as social impact assessments, rehabilitation and resettlement projects, mechanisms for grievance redressal, CSR projects, and policies related to environmental impacts and public policy advocacy."
return result

It also covers the School Board's responsibilities in modifying education programs to improve Indian participation and disseminating revised policies. Additionally, the DLF BRSR.pdf discusses topics such as social impact assessments, rehabilitation and resettlement projects, mechanisms for grievance redressal, CSR projects, and policies related to environmental impacts and public policy advocacy.
